detaileddescription.para: queue system for commands sent to Discord, and any replies
True if to use compression on shards

briefdescription.para: Lock to prevent concurrent access to dm_channels.
Start time of cluster.
Active DM channels for the bot.
Active shards on this cluster. Shard IDs may have gaps between if there are multiple clusters.

detaileddescription.para: Current bot token for all shards on this cluster and all commands sent via HTTP
Total number of shards across all clusters
ID of this cluster, between 0 and MAXCLUSTERS-1 inclusive
Total number of clusters that are active
Routes events from Discord back to user program code via std::functions

briefdescription.para: The details of the bot user. This is assumed to be identical across all shards in the cluster. Each connecting shard updates this information.
Accepts result from /gateway/bot REST API call and populates numshards with it.

parameterdescription.para: Received HTTP data from API call

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &token, uint32_t intents=i_default_intents, uint32_t shards=0, uint32_t cluster_id=0, uint32_t maxclusters=1, bool compressed=true, cache_policy_t policy={cp_aggressive, cp_aggressive, cp_aggressive})
memberdef.name: cluster

briefdescription.para: Constructor for creating a cluster. All but the token are optional.

parameterdescription.para: The bot token to use for all HTTP commands and websocket connections
A bitmask of dpd::intents values for all shards on this cluster. This is required to be sent for all bots with over 100 servers.

The total number of shards on this bot. If there are multiple clusters, then (shards / clusters) actual shards will run on this cluster. If you omit this value, the library will attempt to query the Discord API for the correct number of shards to start.
The ID of this cluster, should be between 0 and MAXCLUSTERS-1
The total number of clusters that are active, which may be on separate processes or even separate machines.
Whether or not to use compression for shards on this cluster. Saves a ton of bandwidth at the cost of some CPU
Set the user caching policy for the cluster, either lazy (only cache users/members when they message the bot) or aggressive (request whole member lists on seeing new guilds too)

briefdescription.para: dpp::cluster is non-copyable
dpp::cluster is non-moveable
Log a message to whatever log the user is using. The logged message is passed up the chain to the on_log event in user code which can then do whatever it wants to do with it.

parameterdescription.para: The log level from dpp::loglevel
The log message to output

briefdescription.para: Get the dm channel for a user id.

parameterdescription.para: the user id to get the dm channel for

briefdescription.para: Set the dm channel id for a user id.

parameterdescription.para: user id to set the dm channel for
dm channel to set

briefdescription.para: Returns the uptime of the cluster.

simplesect.para: dpp::utility::uptime The uptime of the cluster

briefdescription.para: Start the cluster, connecting all its shards. Returns once all shards are connected.

parameterdescription.para: If true the bot will return to your program after starting shards, if false this function will never return.

briefdescription.para: Set the presence for all shards on the cluster.

parameterdescription.para: The presence to set. Only the online status and the first activity are sent.

briefdescription.para: Get a shard by id, returning the discord_client.

parameterdescription.para: Shard ID

briefdescription.para: Get the list of shards.

simplesect.para: shard_list& Reference to map of shards for this cluster

briefdescription.para: on voice state update event

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a log message is to be written to the log. You can attach any logging system here you wish, e.g. spdlog, or even just a simple use of std::cout or printf. If nothing attaches this log event, then the library will be silent.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: on guild join request delete. Triggered when a user declines the membership screening questionnaire for a guild.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new interaction is created. Interactions are created by discord when commands you have registered are issued by a user. For an example of this in action please see Using Slash Commands and Interactions.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a button is clicked attached to a message. Button clicks are triggered by discord when buttons are clicked which you have associated with a message using dpp::component.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a select menu is clicked attached to a message. Select menu clicks are triggered by discord when select menus are clicked which you have associated with a message using dpp::component.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a guild is deleted. A guild can be deleted via the bot being kicked, the bot leaving the guild explicitly with dpp::guild_delete, or via the guild being unavaialble due to an outage.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a channel is deleted from a guild. The channel will still be temporarily avaialble in the cache. Pointers to the channel should not be retained long-term as they will be deleted by the garbage collector.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a channel is edited on a guild. The new channel details have already been applied to the guild when you receive this event.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a shard is connected and ready. A set of on_guild_create events will follow this event.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a message is deleted. The message has already been deleted from Discord when you receive this event.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when an application command (slash command) is deleted.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a user leaves a guild (either through being kicked, or choosing to leave)

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new application command (slash command) is registered.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a connection to a shard successfully resumes. A resumed session does not need to re-synchronise guilds, members, etc. This is generally non-fatal and informational only.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new role is created on a guild.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a user is typing on a channel.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new reaction is added to a message.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a set of members is received for a guild. D++ will request these for all new guilds if needed, after the on_guild_create events.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a single reaction is removed from a message.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new guild is created. D++ will request members for the guild for its cache using guild_members_chunk.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new channel is created on a guild.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when all reactions for a particular emoji are removed from a message.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when multiple messages are deleted from a channel or DM.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when an existing role is updated on a guild.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a role is deleted in a guild.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a message is pinned. Note that the pinned message is not returned to this event, just the timestamp of the last pinned message.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when all reactions are removed from a message.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when we are told which voice server we can use. This will be sent either when we establish a new voice channel connection, or as discord rearrange their infrastructure.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when new emojis are added to a guild. The complete set of emojis is sent every time.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when new stickers are added to a guild. The complete set of stickers is sent every time.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a user's presence is updated. To receive these you will need the GUILD_PRESENCES privileged intent. You will receive many of these, very often, and receiving them will significaintly increase your bot's CPU usage. If you don't need them it is recommended to not ask for them.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when the webhooks for a guild are updated.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new member joins a guild.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when an invite is deleted from a guild.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when details of a guild are updated.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when an integration is updated for a guild. This returns the complete list. An integration is a connection to a guild of a user's associated accounts, e.g. youtube or twitch, for automatic assignment of roles etc.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when details of a guild member (e.g. their roles or nickname) are updated.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when an application command (slash command) is updated. You will only receive this event for application commands that belong to your bot/application.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new invite is created for a guild.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a message is updated (edited).

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a user is updated. This is separate to guild_member_update and includes things such as an avatar change, username change, discriminator change or change in subscription status for nitro.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new message arrives from discord. Note that D++ does not cache messages. If you want to cache these objects you should create something yourself within your bot. Caching of messages is not on the roadmap to be supported as it consumes excessive amounts of RAM.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a ban is added to a guild.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a ban is removed from a guild.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new intgration is attached to a guild by a user. An integration is a connection to a guild of a user's associated accounts, e.g. youtube or twitch, for automatic assignment of roles etc.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when an integration is updated by a user. This returns details of just the single integration that has changed. An integration is a connection to a guild of a user's associated accounts, e.g. youtube or twitch, for automatic assignment of roles etc.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when an integration is removed by a user. An integration is a connection to a guild of a user's associated accounts, e.g. youtube or twitch, for automatic assignment of roles etc.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a thread is created Note: Threads are not cached by D++, but a list of thread IDs is accessible in a guild object.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a thread is updated.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a thread is deleted.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when thread list is synced (upon gaining access to a channel) Note: Threads are not cached by D++, but a list of thread IDs is accessible in a guild object.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when current user's thread member object is updated.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a thread's member list is updated (without GUILD_MEMBERS intent, is only called for current user)

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when packets are sent from the voice buffer. The voice buffer contains packets that are already encoded with Opus and encrypted with Sodium, and merged into packets by the repacketizer, which is done in the dpp::discord_voice_client::send_audio method. You should use the buffer size properties of dpp::voice_buffer_send_t to determine if you should fill the buffer with more content.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a user is talking on a voice channel.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a voice channel is connected and ready to send audio. Note that this is not directly attached to the READY event of the websocket, as there is further connection that needs to be done before audio is ready to send.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when new audio data is received.

simplesect.para: Receiveing audio for bots is not supported or documented, so this endpoint will be triggered at the correct times but the audio buffer will always be null and size zero.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when sending of audio passes over a track marker. Track markers are arbitrarily placed "bookmarks" in the audio buffer, placed by the bot developer. Each track marker can have a string value associated with it which is specified in dpp::discord_voice_client::insert_marker and returned to this event.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when a new stage instance is created on a stage channel.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

briefdescription.para: Called when an existing stage instance is deleted from a stage channel.

parameterdescription.para: User function to attach to event

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &endpoint, const std::string &major_parameters, const std::string &parameters, http_method method, const std::string &postdata, json_encode_t callback, const std::string &filename="", const std::string &filecontent="")
memberdef.name: post_rest

briefdescription.para: Post a REST request. Where possible use a helper method instead like message_create.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint to post to, e.g. /api/guilds
Major parameters for the endpoint e.g. a guild id
Minor parameters for the API request
Method, e.g. GET, POST
Post data (usually JSON encoded)
Function to call when the HTTP call completes. The callback parameter will contain amongst other things, the decoded json.
Filename to post for POST requests (for uploading files)
File content to post for POST requests (for uploading files)

memberdef.argsstring: (snowflake interaction_id, const std::string &token, const interaction_response &r, command_completion_event_t callback={})
memberdef.name: interaction_response_create

briefdescription.para: Respond to a slash command.

parameterdescription.para: Interaction id to respond to
Token for the interaction webhook
Response to send

Function to call when the API call completes. On success the callback will contain a dpp::confirmation object in confirmation_callback_t::value. On failure, the value is undefined and confirmation_callback_t::is_error() method will return true. You can obtain full error details with confirmation_callback_t::get_error().

parameterdescription.para: Token for the interaction webhook
Message to send

On failure, the value is undefined and confirmation_callback_t::is_error() method will return true. You can obtain full error details with confirmation_callback_t::get_error().

briefdescription.para: Create/overwrite guild slash commands.

parameterdescription.para: Vector of slash commands to create/update. New guild commands will be available in the guild immediately. If the command did not already exist, it will count toward daily application command create limits.
Guild ID to create/update the slash commands in

Function to call when the API call completes. On success the callback will contain a list of dpp::slashcommmand object in confirmation_callback_t::value. On failure, the value is undefined and confirmation_callback_t::is_error() method will return true. You can obtain full error details with confirmation_callback_t::get_error().

briefdescription.para: Create/overwrite global slash commands.

parameterdescription.para: Vector of slash commands to create/update. overwriting existing commands that are registered globally for this application. Updates will be available in all guilds after 1 hour. Commands that do not already exist will count toward daily application command create limits.

Function to call when the API call completes. On success the callback will contain a list of dpp::slashcommmand object in confirmation_callback_t::value. On failure, the value is undefined and confirmation_callback_t::is_error() method will return true. You can obtain full error details with confirmation_callback_t::get_error().

briefdescription.para: Create a sticker in a guild.

parameterdescription.para: Sticker to create. Must have its guild ID set.

Function to call when the API call completes. On success the callback will contain a dpp::sticker object in confirmation_callback_t::value. On failure, the value is undefined and confirmation_callback_t::is_error() method will return true. You can obtain full error details with confirmation_callback_t::get_error().

Function to call when the API call completes. On success the callback will contain a dpp::sticker object in confirmation_callback_t::value. briefdescription.para: The cluster class represents a group of shards and a command queue for sending and receiving commands from discord via HTTP. You should usually instantiate a cluster object at the very least to make use of the library.
